text.0: coming at early morn he gives his treasure the prudent one receives and entertains him.
text.1: thereby increasing still his life and offspring he comes with brave sons to abundant riches.
text.2: rich shall he be in gold and kine and horses indra bestows on him great vital power.
text.3: who stays thee as thou comest with his treasure like game caught in the net o early comer.
text.4: longing i came this morning to the pious the son of sacrifice with car wealthladen.
text.5: give him to drink juice of the stalk that gladdens prosper with pleasant hymns the lord of heroes.
text.6: healthbringing streams as milchcows flow to profit him who hath worshipped him who now will worship.
text.7: to him who freely gives and fills on all sides full streams of fatness flow and make him famous.
text.8: on the high ridge of heaven he stands exalted yea to the gods he goes the liberal giver.
text.9: the streams the waters flow for him with fatness to him this guerdon ever yields abundance.
text.10: for those who give rich meeds are all these splendours for those who give rich meeds suns shine in heaven.
text.11: the givers of rich meeds are made immortal the givers of rich fees prolong their lifetime.
text.12: let not the liberal sink to sin and sorrow never decay the pious chiefs who worship.
text.13: let every man besides be their protection and let affliction fall upon the niggard.
